intro: Bilacunaria aksekiensis, commonly known as the Akseki bilacunaria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
